titleEn: Who Killed That Good Paper? Chaos in Top AI Conferences: Quality Papers Rejected While Low-Score Papers Are Overpraised
descriptionEn: When AI begins deciding which AI papers get accepted, the concept of "peer review" becomes particularly ironic. Recently, an anonymous AAAI 2026 reviewer posted on Reddit about experiencing the "strangest" review process in history: quality papers being rejected, weak papers advancing, and what appeared to be "connection-facilitated submissions" receiving protection. Even more absurdly, AI was being used to summarize review comments. When algorithms intertwine with personal connections, can academic integrity still be trusted?
